subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (4/5). ASML's ultra-advanced lithography machines are used to etch the most cutting-edge microprocessors, which are crucial for artificial intelligence – a major strategic issue.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un orders factories to make more missiles in 2026
subhead: In a visit to munitions factories accompanied by top officials, the state-run Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) said the North Korean leader had ordered the factories to prepare for a busy year ahead.

title: Arthur Hadade, the chameleon who launched the 'Spotify of contemporary art'
subhead: With Cur8, his app dedicated to navigating the contemporary art world, the 35-year-old entrepreneur aims to challenge stereotypes surrounding a field often perceived as highly codified and inaccessible.

title: Why more young people are turning to religion
subhead: Many researchers have observed a resurgence of religious commitment among young people in France, often accompanied by a certain rigorism. This renewed spiritual quest is linked both to the anxieties of our era and, at times, a search for identity.

title: Giorgia Meloni: Neo-fascist or far right? Why Italian PM's tenure raises questions among political experts
subhead: The Italian prime minister has been in power now for three years. Italy's political experts question the normalization of this leader, who comes from a neo-fascist background. Has her tenure really been accompanied by a moderation of her political views?

title: Celebrate the season with Le Monde in English's most beloved holiday movies
